description: Despite the US and Ukrainian presidents congratulating themselves about the outcome of their meeting on Sunday, the prospect of an agreement to end the nearly four-year war between Kyiv and Moscow still seems far off.

description: Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his weekly column that the European Union finds itself less able to withstand Donald Trump's blows to international law in Ukraine, having itself condoned such violations in Gaza.

headline: China announces 'major' military exercises around Taiwan
description: Beijing's latest show of force follows a round of arms sales to Taipei by the United States. Taiwan's Defense Ministry condemned China as the 'greatest destroyer of peace,' and the Taiwanese military said it had established a response center with 'appropriate forces.'

headline: Municipal elections: Louis Sarkozy tries to make a splash in French Riviera town
description: The son of the former French president is running a headline-grabbing campaign in Mention, both on the ground and across social media, as he tries to make a name for himself in a city where the far right enjoys strong support.

headline: 'From sex appeal to the far right': Brigitte Bardot's death in the international press
description: International media outlets paid tribute to Bardot, who died on Sunday, celebrating her film career and her social influence from the 1950s onward, yet also calling out her political choices, which later drifted toward the far right.
byline: Minh Dréan and  Romain Del Bello

Brigitte Bardot's 30 years of sympathy for the far right
description: Convicted five times for racist remarks, the actress – whose foundation announced her death on Sunday, December 28 – remained one of the only French celebrities to openly embrace far-right views.

headline: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
description: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.

headline: Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
description: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.
